Issues.Title: fix(common): invalid ImageKit transformation
Issues.Body: `q-auto` is an invalid/unsupported transformation and should not be used ## PR Checklist Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements: - [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit - [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) - [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [x] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes - [ ] CI related changes - [ ] Documentation content changes - [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes - [ ] Other... Please describe: ## What is the current behavior? The `ImageLoader` for ImageKit is using an invalid/unsupported transformation (`q-auto`). Being that I could not find any mention of this transformation in [the official documentation](https://docs.imagekit.io/features/image-transformations/resize-crop-and-other-transformations#quality-q), I contacted ImageKit's support and they said: > q-auto while would result in different sizes because of some internal implementations, being an unsupported, undocumented feature, it should not be used in any application. Issue Number: N/A ## What is the new behavior? The `q-auto` invalid transformation is not used. Instead, we rely on the default quality value from ImageKit's dashboard, which unless modified is 80 (`q-80`). ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [x] No ## Other information Unless modified (and if not overwritten via URL), ImageKit applies the following transformations: - Automatic format (`f-auto`) - Quality = 80 (`q-80`)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): invalid ImageKit transformation" (#49201)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): do not persist component analysis if template/styles are missing
Issues.Body:
Consider the following scenario:

1. A TS file with a component and templateUrl exists
2. The template file does not exist.
3. First build: ngtsc will properly report the error, via a FatalDiagnosticError
4. The template file is now created
5. Second build: ngtsc still reports the same errror.

Ngtsc persists the analysis data of the component and never invalidates it when the template/style
file becomes available later.

This breaks incremental builds and potentially common workflows where resource files are added
later after the TS file is created. This did not surface as an issue in the Angular CLI yet because Webpack 
requires users to re-start the process when a new file is added. With ESBuild this will change and this
also breaks incremental builds with Bazel/Blaze workers.

To fix this, we have a few options:

* Invalidate the analysis when e.g. the template file is missing. Never caching it means that it will be
re-analyzed on every build iteration.
* Add the resource dependency to ngtsc's incremental file graph. ngtsc will then know via `host.getModifiedResources` when the file becomes available- and fresh analysis of component would occur.

The first approach is straightforward to implement and was chosen here. The second approach would
allow ngtsc to re-use more of the analysis when we know that e.g. the template file still not there, but it 
ncreases complexity unnecessarily because there is no **single** obvious resource path for e.g. a `templateUrl`.
The URL is attempted to be resolved using multiple strategies, such as TS program root dirs, or there is support
for a custom resolution through `host.resourceNameToFileName`.

It would be possible to determine some candidate paths and add them to the dependency tracker, but it
seems incomplete given possible external resolvers like `resourceNameToFileName` and also would likely 
not have a sufficient-enough impact given that a broken component decorator is not expected to remain
for too long between N incremental build iterations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler-cli): do not persist component analysis if template/styles are missing" (#49184)

Issues.Title: [FeatureRequest] Run TypeCheck with ngtsc just like you run tsc --noEmit
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, lint

### Description

We would like to create a pre-commit script that check for compiling errors in the changed files in our project.
We do this with `tsc --noEmit file.ts` today and it works well for `ts` errors. But it won't find `ngtsc` errors like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5993909/221140302-f87edb63-1b2f-4bad-a6bc-7de918db8ccf.png)

Is it possible to do this today? I have tried the linter, but since it's not a syntax error it won't fail the linter.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be nice to be able to type-check specific files without doing a full build.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We have already tried all solutions we could think of.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[FeatureRequest] Run TypeCheck with ngtsc just like you run tsc --noEmit" (#49194)

Issues.Title: Standalone migration fails in various cases
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I've tried the new standalone migration inside one of our larger projects (managed by NX). By doing so, I've noticed the following issues:
- Barrel imports are not used. This results in _a lot_ of specific component/directive imports being added. 
- Typescript `paths` are not used. E.g. importing from a library into another one results in a relative import instead of `@my-org/lib`. This is probably a little tricky, since this is exactly what should happen from within the same library, so we don't end up with the library importing itself.
- The migration seems to break as soon as a library is added to the projects folder via `ng add` (so inside a non NX workspace)

I've created a repo reflecting all the mentioned issues above.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/TomTomB/ng-sa-migration-issues

```true
(none)
```

Issues.Title: Parent Zone missing with custom Zone fork inside an rxjs Observable operator
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

For performance monitoring we built a library combining [zone.js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zone.js) and the [Javascript native Error stack](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/stack) which wrapp some functions to keep tracking of the call stack and monitoring their run time.   

We currently struggle using it inside Angular applications because it seems that the angular core do something that make us lose track of our call stack if we use our wrapper around functions that contains rxjs Observables.

## Step for bug reproduction
- Clone this [repository](https://github.com/sdedieu/angular-zone-custom-fork-parent-lost-in-rxjs-operators)
- Run the `npm ci` command to install dependencies
- Run the `ng serve` command to start the project on `http:localhost:4200`
- Open `http:localhost:4200` on a web browser.

### Issue (current behaviour)
Two wrapped functions are called inside the `ngOnInit` method.
- The first one using `rxjs Observable` display in the console: `obs_bar angular`.
- The second one using `Promise` display in the console: `promise_bar promise_foo`.

### Expected behaviour
As the one using `Promise`, the wrapped method using `rxjs Observable` should display in the console: `obs_bar obs_foo`

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/sdedieu/angular-zone-custom-fork-parent-lost-in-rxjs-operators

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
The wrapped method using `rxjs Observable` display `obs_bar angular` in the console instead of `obs_bar obs_foo`
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.0
Node: 16.15.0
Package Manager: npm 8.5.5
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 15.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.0
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.0
@schematics/angular             15.2.0
rxjs                            7.8.0
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else?

Funny thoughts, it works on [this Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mht2rc?file=src%2Fmain.ts)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Parent Zone missing with custom Zone fork inside an rxjs Observable operator" (#49178)

Issues.Title: Request a totally covered tastcase in Injector.get when default value is provided
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

In issue [#47109](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/47109), it pointed that the default value not worked when use `InjectFlags.Host` mode.

```
const d = injector.get(NON_PROVIDED_TOKEN, 'default value', InjectFlags.Host);
```

But, at the same situation, `InjectFlags.Self` mode will caught error either. The problom could only be found in `ElementInjector` but not in `ModuleInjector`, so both `InjectFlags.Self` and `InjectFlags.Host` are involved.

[Here](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qpfnex?file=src%2Fmain.ts) is my repo with ng14.2.0.

---
```
Angular CLI: 14.2.10       
Node: 16.15.0
Package Manager: npm 8.5.5 
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.10
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.10
@angular/cli                    14.2.10
@schematics/angular             14.2.10
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.7.4
```
---

Although, this issue is fixed in this [commit](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/47242/commits/82e6c894c5f3b5868c8f45a71bce5f5af1791fbe), and fortunately, `InjectFlags.Self` situation would be fixed together. But It is a little pity that the test case in commit not covered the `InjectFlags.Self` situation. I suppose maybe it will be a hidden trouble unless a fully covered testcase be offered.


### Proposed solution

Make a illustration about `InjectFlags.Self` situation and add a testcase about InjectFlags.Self` situation.

### Alternatives considered

no
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Request a totally covered tastcase in Injector.get when default value is provided" (#49192)

Issues.Title: Injectable.useFactory is not invoked in some cases
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Here is a simple class annotated with the `Injectable` decorator, which also uses `useFactory`:

```
@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'root',
  useFactory: () => { ... }
})
class SomeService {}
```

When a class like this goes through this codepath: 

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/79cdfeb3921687dfbc8fea8d9f7ba4dbb14a7193/packages/core/src/di/r3_injector.ts#L469

The `useFactory` is never invoked and instead the class instance is created via `new` as normal.

Here is a repro using [Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-kbxhwd?file=src%2Fmain.ts).

Came across this issue while working with the TransferState class, which has the following setup:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/79cdfeb3921687dfbc8fea8d9f7ba4dbb14a7193/packages/platform-browser/src/browser/transfer_state.ts#L86-L96

### Potential solution

The mentioned line in the `r3_injector.ts` should probably be updated to flip the `getFactoryDef` and `injectableDefOrInjectorDefFactory` calls (or just drop the `getFactoryDef` call, since it's also present inside `injectableDefOrInjectorDefFactory` one).

This would likely become a breaking change, since there is a potential for new code paths to be executed (which were not invoked before).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Injectable.useFactory is not invoked in some cases" (#49190)

Issues.Title: Schematic utils are not available anymore in @angular/core since version 15.1.0
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

The angular/core schematics utils were available in the npm package @angular/core up to version 15.0.4, for example like so:
`import { getProjectTsConfigPaths } from '@angular/core/schematics/utils/project_tsconfig_paths';`
I depend on them to be able to write custom migrations for a design-system.

Unfortunately, these are no longer available since version 15.1.0.
I could not find any information about this change in the [changelog](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md).
And as it's kind of a breaking change I'm asking myself if this happend intentional?

Utils still there:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular/core/v/15.0.4?activeTab=explore -> /schematics/utils 
Utils gone:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular/core/v/15.1.0?activeTab=explore -> /schematics/???

Would it be possible to reintegrate them in the released package or is there another way to use them from somewhere else?

Thanks for your help!

I even tryed to get an anwer about that on stack-overflow before, but without any success till now: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75522436/schematic-utils-are-not-available-anymore-in-angular-core-since-version-15-1-0.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.1.6
Node: 16.19.1
Package Manager: pnpm 7.27.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: undefined
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1501.6
@angular-devkit/core         15.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics   15.1.0
@schematics/angular          15.1.6
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(common): make Location.normalize() return the correct path when the base path contains characters that interfere with regex syntax.
Issues.Body:
Fix the function stripping the base path from the URL, as the current implementation uses the base path as part of a regex, which wrongly makes paths fails that contain characters such as a parenthesis (example: C:/Users/MyUser(Test)/project).

Fixes #49179

Issues.Title: Location incorrectly handled when served from a base path containing regex-specific characters.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common, router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When serving an Angular build from the file system (such as in Electron), if Angular is served from a path containing regex-syntax characters, the Angular router gets lost.

The bug was introduced in Angular 5.1.1 after this commit:
https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/48489

Serving Angular from the following path would fail:
C:/Users/MyUser(Test)/my-project

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

No reproduction link as it is environment specific.

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
When this happens, the Angular application goes blank and only the error "NG04002" is shown in console with nothing else going on.
```

Issues.Body:
Can now get module declarations of modules other than RouterModule. This is useful for adding a custom declaration to module using schematics. Checking the spec files will show a use case for this new feature, now the getModuleDeclarationByName function can be used to get the module declaration of a custom module, in this case ngxsModule.

Issues.Title: Angular CLI 15.1.4 breaks ng test with jsdom because CLI is loading JavaScript bundles as module
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.1.3

### Description

I have a standard Angular project, using Karma & Jasmine for unit tests. The unit tests run can run in either Chrome or jsdom. I need jsdom because my CI environment doesn't have Chrome (org policy: no browsers on servers).

Angular CLI 15.1.4 introduced a change in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/24620 wherein Javascript bundles are loaded as modules. 

Unfortunately, jsdom doesn't support <script type="module">; it simply doesn't load the module scripts. This is a known issue in jsdom - https://github.com/jsdom/jsdom/issues/2475

Ideally jsdom would add module support; but since that ticket has been open for four years, I'm not holding out much hope. So instead, here's my request:

**REQUEST:** Could Angular CLI add a flag to add/omit type="module" ?

My workaround for now is patching jsdom (using patch-package) to ignore the type attribute on <script type="module">.

### Minimal Reproduction

Clone my git repo: https://github.com/andrewpmontgomery/angular-15-jsdom
1. Run `npm install`
2. Run `npm run test:chrome` and all three tests should pass.
3. Run `npm run test:jsdom` and it should time-out.
4. Run `npm run patch-package`
5. Run `npm run test:jsdom` again and now it works.


### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.0
Node: 16.19.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.0

@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.0
```

Issues.Title: ES Build Angular - Uncaught TypeError: Class extends value undefined is not a constructor or null
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi Team,

I have just tried to build our large Angular using the new brower-esbuild and the Angular CLI 15.2.0.

The ng build command takes about 40 seconds and on the surface appears to finish outputing just some minor warnings.

However, when I attempt to run the app, I get the following error in the browser console and the app does not run -

```
Uncaught TypeError: Class extends value undefined is not a constructor or null
    at app.security.ts:19:7 
```

Which points to this line 

`export class AppSecurityModule extends BaseSecurityModule<AppSecurityRight> {`

Just some points about our code base.

1. We use typescript paths so we can reference our code using @jms/xxxx
2. We have a model folder that is symlinked to appear as @jms\model in both our Angular App and NodeJS app. The code above is inside the symlinked folder.

Issues.Title: --exclude option for ng test not working
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi,

I'm trying to have 2 separate test runs, so i'm trying to include and exclude spec files.

I have this command to **include**
`ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --include='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

Reading the [docs](https://angular.io/cli/test), I see **exclude** option, so using the same pattern:

`ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --exclude='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

But i get the following error

```
ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --exclude='**/regression/*.spec.ts'

Error: Unknown argument: exclude

Process finished with exit code 1
```

I'm not sure if the docs are incorrect or if i'm doing something wrong? 

Any help would be much appreciated





### Minimal Reproduction

1. Run ng test command with --exclude option like so:
2. `ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --excludes='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

### Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Improve Hot Module Replacement (HMR)
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Angular CLI currently supports HMR via `ng serve --hmr` though it isn't the ideal experience. Under the hood, this mostly rerenders the Angular application from scratch, which is better than a full page reload, but could definitely be improved. @alan-agius4 has suggested a number of opportunities for improving HMR. Most importantly, our strategy here should be to optimize the turnaround time for any given change _scaled_ with the frequency of that kind of change. For example, it is very common to make numerous tiny adjustments to CSS in quick succession while finding the precise styling needed for a page. This is a very hot path to optimize and even marginal improvements here can have a bit impact due to how frequently CSS-only changes are made during development.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Some ideas to improve HMR include (but are not limited to):

* Fast track CSS-only changes and apply them to any existing components on the page.
    * This should be relatively straightforward since we mostly need to correlate a component class with its `<style />` tag on the page, then delete and recreate that tag with the new CSS content. This would be very fast and maintain page state.
    * Supporting inline styles is a bit more complicated but should be achievable?
* Fast track Angular template-only changes and apply them to any existing components on the page.
    * In theory, we just need to delete the generated JavaScript render functions for a component and overwrite them with the new render functions from the modified template, then re-apply the DOM.
    * In practice, I think this is a challenge as Angular templates aren't completely stateless (ex. `async` pipe). But this is likely achievable in some capacity. Should be pretty quick and mostly maintain page state.
    * Supporting inline templates is a bit more complicated but should be achievable?
* Re-render only the currently displayed Angular route, rather than the full application.
    * Statistically speaking, most code changes will be within the currently displayed Angular route and won't impact anything outside the route. In many cases, it would be sufficient to just rerender that one route.

Angular template and CSS changes in particular are two areas where users frequently make a large number of small changes in quick succession and in a manner which is easy for tooling to reason about. These are two spaces where we can have a huge impact on developer's quality of life.

If we can get this good enough, I'd love to get to a place where we could turn `--hmr` on by default in `ng serve`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

HMR is mostly one facet of the larger problem around "How do we make the time between editing a file and reloading its changes in the browser as quick as possible?" (edit/refresh time). HMR is one means of getting built changes into the running browser faster and maintain the application's current state. We should (and are) investigating ways to improve the overall edit/refresh experience independent of HMR.

More related to HMR, the focus on Angular template and CSS changes does highlight a lack of focus on TypeScript changes. This is somewhat intentional. Angular has strong separation of concerns between Angular templates (for HTML/DOM rendering), CSS (for styling), and TypeScript (for component functionality). While this isn't absolute and TypeScript can often containing rendering or styling functionality (ex. list filters or conditional CSS classes), the vast majority of DOM and CSS changes made by a developer will be done by editing a template or a stylesheet, not TypeScript.

TypeScript changes are also very tricky to apply consistently with HMR. As one example, renaming a class field in TypeScript _can_ be HMR'd, however doing so often leads to inconsistencies and confusing behavior. HMR is intended to maintain the current user state, but it is effectively impossible for the build process to understand that deleting a `foo` field and creating a `bar` field as intended as a rename and state should be transferred from one property to the other during HMR. At runtime, it looks like this renamed field just "forgot" all its state, which can easily break the component and cause errors which require a full page reload to fix. That's one example, but the sheer variety of possible changes a user can make to TypeScript code means it can never be totally consistent or reliable.

We should definitely be open to improvements here where we can take advantage of them, and we should make sure not to let "perfect" be the enemy of "good enough". The key takeaway here is that HMR of TypeScript-only changes in Angular is simultaneously the hardest to do right, and also the least impactful. Again, _scaling_ the impact of optimizing a particular change with the _frequency_ that kind of change occurs is where we can find the most value for users.

/cc @alan-agius4 for other ideas around improving HMR, definitely lots of cool stuff we're hoping to do here.

Issues.Title: bug(mat-chip): ngIf on matChipRemove breaks style
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi,
When using the `mat-chip` with a button that has the `matChipRemove` directive combined with the `*ngIf` structural directive, as the condition changes from true / false, the `mat-chip` does not seem to correctly handle the state change in it's css styling.



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. add a mat-chip in your template

2. add a button with an `matChipRemove` directive and an `*ngIf` directive that resolves a condition
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8459019/221306084-d0d6f30f-0901-4f61-b033-93cc376dd209.png)

3. change the condition value so the button is removed/added to the DOM
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8459019/221306354-9a0633d3-fcd7-48c0-8161-0b7339049fcb.png)

Notice that the padding of the chips does not reflect the state.

Demo: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-6ngj4w?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchips-overview-example.html

### Expected Behavior

Should apply correct styling (ex: padding)

### Actual Behavior

The text and size of the padding are broken after a structural change

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome latest
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: bug(mat-stepper): MatStepper and MatStep not working through content projection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hello. I'm not sure if this is by design, but I'd expect this code to work. MatStepper is already using `descendants: true` in it's `@ContentChildren` query so I'd assume this is allowed.

```ts
import 'zone.js/dist/zone';
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
import { bootstrapApplication } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { MatStepperModule } from '@angular/material/stepper';

@Component({
  selector: 'my-app-stepper-container',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [MatStepperModule],
  template: `
  <mat-stepper>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </mat-stepper>
  `
})
export class StepperContainer {}

@Component({
  selector: 'my-app',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [CommonModule, MatStepperModule, StepperContainer],
  template: `
    <my-app-stepper-container>
      <mat-step>my step</mat-step>
    </my-app-stepper-container>
  `,
})
export class App {
  name = 'Angular';
}

bootstrapApplication(App);
```
```
ERROR
Error: R3InjectorError(Standalone[App])[MatStepper -> MatStepper -> MatStepper]:
NullInjectorError: No provider for MatStepper!
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tnkyk1?devToolsHeight=33&file=src/main.ts

### Expected Behavior

`MatStepper` and `MatStep` work through content projection.

### Actual Behavior

`NullInjectorError` is thrown.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 110.0.5481.177 (Official Build) (x86_64)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have a styling library which styles all material components based on a given desing specs.  But material v15 has migrated all angular components styles to [MDC components](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web) which broke all our extisting styles because of DOM structure change.

Now we are again planning to styles all MDC components but this time we want to follow future proof styling path but I don't see any document which I can follow and add extensive styles on top of MDC styles.

I can see material now using `--mdc-*` custom properties for all components and using those variables I can override the styles but I don't see any documentation for the same.

Angular material now using [MDC](https://m2.material.io/components/) styles but MDC suggesting [Material Design 3](https://github.com/material-components/material-web) which is yet another web component library based on Lit.

Does Angular material continue using [MDC](https://m2.material.io/components/) components styles or planning to use  [Material Design 3](https://github.com/material-components/material-web) styles. 

What should be the best path for such users who want to override styles on top of Angular material library.

NA

### Expected Behavior

There should be a proper documentation for style overriding 

### Actual Behavior

NA

Issues.Title: bug(google-maps): google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP returning undefined when pushing measure distance widget
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We are running some unit tests for our google map component where the tests seem to fail due to `google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` returning undefined when trying to push the measure distance widget element in our `ngAfterViewInit()` function like so: `this.map.controls[google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP].push(measureDistanceWidgetRootElement)`

where `measureDistanceWidgetRootElement` is defined as a native element:
`this.measureDistanceWidget.map = this.map.googleMap!`
`let measureDistanceWidgetRootElement = this.measureDistanceWidget.element.nativeElement`

Error output:
`TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'push')`

However, all the tests pass once we change the control position to a value that does not return undefined, like `google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_BOTTOM`. This behavior is only observed when running the unit tests and not while the application is running, the measure distance widget works as expected. Therefore, we want to know why some control positions are returning undefined while others are not and if this error could be replicated.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

Create a measure distance widget component and try pushing it to the RIGHT_TOP control position in ngAfterViewInit() as a native element, something like this:

`this.measureDistanceWidget.map = this.map.googleMap!
let measureDistanceWidgetRootElement = this.measureDistanceWidget.element.nativeElement
this.map.controls[google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP].push(
            measureDistanceWidgetRootElement
        )`

### Expected Behavior

`google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` should not return undefined and the unit tests pass.

### Actual Behavior

`google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` returns undefined and the unit tests fail.`

### Environment

- Angular CLI: 13.3.10
- Node: 16.14.0
- Package Manager: npm 8.3.1
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 64 bit

Package                         Version

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenuTriggerFor within cdkContextMenuTriggerFor causes repositioning when hovered
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using a `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` within a container that has a `[cdkContextMenuTriggerFor]` for the same cdkMenu.

Current behavior:
 When a cdkMenu is opened by the `[cdkContextMenuTriggerFor]` the cdkMenu it will be repositioned to the `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` when the `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` is hovered.

Expected behavior:
the cdkMenu should stay at its current location, even if `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` is hovered.

In case this is confirmed as a bug, I could provide a PR fixing the issue

### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-uo4741?file=src/app/example-component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Right click on Lucas ipsum
2. hover Open Context Menu button


### Expected Behavior

contextMenu does not change position

### Actual Behavior

contextMenu moves to the location of the button trigger

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu

Can also be reproduced with the dev-app in the components repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenuTriggerFor within cdkContextMenuTriggerFor causes repositioning when hovered" (#26675)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-checkbox): Value gets removed when disable is present on Formcontrol
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Not 100% sure if this is a bug or intended feature but it causing me a bit of a headache.  

I have a dynamically generated form to manage user permissions across a bunch of tools and has a few stipulations on how those permissions can be added or removed based on grantable/role permissions I want to be able to disable those mat checkboxes but still have a potential value for them however I noticed that if disable is added to the formcontrol when adding to a formarray the value is getting completely removed.

Is there a way around this, any help would be greatly appreciated.

### Reproduction

reproduced stackblitz
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wtakex?file=src/app.component.ts

### Expected Behavior

Even if disable is added there should still be a value

### Actual Behavior

Value is removed when disable is present on formcontrol

### Environment

- Angular: v15
- CDK/Material: v15
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): mat-option sets aria-selected="false"
Issues.Body:
For mat-option, set `aria-selected="false"` on deselected options. Confirms with [WAI ARIA Listbox authoring practices guide](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/listbox/), which says to always include aria-selected attribute on listbox options that can be selected. Fix issue where VoiceOver reads every option as "selected" (21491).

Fix #21491
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): mat-option sets aria-selected="false"" (#26673)

Issues.Title: fix(material/list): add disabled attribute for mat-list-item buttons
Issues.Body:
Previously, mat-list-item buttons did not have the `disabled` attribute set when either the `mat-list-item` or the `mat-action-list` are disabled.
This commit adds the `disabled` attribute to `mat-list-item` buttons when it should be applied.

Fixes #26574.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/list): add disabled attribute for mat-list-item buttons" (#26672)

Issues.Title: Angular material table sort arrow not resetting to original state
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

In the Angular material table, When I click on the sort icon in one of the table headers to descending then I am clicking on another table header then the data in the table get updated but in UI the previous column sort icon is not changing until I am hovering the mouse in the particular column header.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46444516/220293418-5f7b56de-ae42-4a45-9e07-356320a26df4.png)

In the example, I sorted the 1st column "ID" into descending and then I clicked on the 3rd column "Progress" sort icon. The data got updated perfectly but the icon in the 1st column didn't change. It got updated when I hover the mouse on the ID.

**Working Demo:**

[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cbr9nv?file=src%2Fstyles.scss,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-overview-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-overview-example.css](url)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Make the sort icons in the table header always visible. 
2. Click the sort icon to descending in 1st column.
3. Click on the sort icon to descending in the 3rd column 
4. Now you can see the 1st column icon is not updated until you are manually hovering.
5. Stackblitz: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cbr9nv?file=src%2Fstyles.scss,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-overview-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-overview-example.css](url)
the 

### Expected Behavior

When sorting on another column is pressed then the sorting on the previous column should get updated without manually hovering 

### Actual Behavior

The previous sorting column icon is not updated until manually hovering in table header 

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular material table sort arrow not resetting to original state" (#26665)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): mat-mdc-text-field-wrapper flex auto too tall outline w/dynamic subscriptSizing
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When two mat-form-field's are added to the same div, setting one to fixed subscript sizing and the other to dynamic will result in the outline being too big when there are no errors or hints.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18607666/220198322-d01d30b8-2836-42c4-851f-039f95442a4d.png)

Removing the flex auto property of the mat-mdc-text-field-wrapper seems to fix the problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18607666/220198466-d1da2d98-065f-481e-998c-4306bf4a3cd3.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a div (mine's a flex with row wrap) 
2. Fill it with too mat-form-field's, one with subscriptSizing set to dynamic and the other left defaulted to fixed.


### Expected Behavior

The mat-input in the dynamically sized form field will have the same height as its counterpart.

### Actual Behavior

The mat-input in the dynamically sized form field stretches to fill the size of the input and empty bottom margin of its fixed counterpart.

### Environment

- Angular: ^15.0.1
- CDK/Material: ^15.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): mat-mdc-text-field-wrapper flex auto too tall outline w/dynamic subscriptSizing" (#26663)

Issues.Title: bug(Menu): Up and down arrow keys do not cycle through all options
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

[StackBlitz reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zsnfkb-zklan5?file=src/app/app.component.ts)

When using keyboard navigation (up and down arrows) on the options on a Material Menu, in the reproduction example above, the arrow keys do not reach all items.

GIF:

Pressing the Down or Up arrow keys never reaches the "Feature A" item, it just cycles back to the top.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36610621/220189514-bbcac50f-2ae1-4582-8549-ece2a4649fdd.mp4

HTML of the Material Menu and menu items. The 3rd button can't be navigated to using the keyboard up and down arrows.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36610621/220189760-434b6718-ba56-4fa0-bf4f-9a8dbb714cd7.png)

In this case, the issue happens when Menu Items (`mat-menu-item`) are added to the Menu (`mat-menu`) with a `<ng-content select="...">` directive .

The use case (minimally demonstrated in the example) is a common menu shared across multiple features, and each feature will add their own option to the menu.

### Reproduction

[StackBlitz reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-zsnfkb-zklan5?file=src/app/app.component.ts)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the StackBlitz above
2. Navigate to one of the Material Menu trigger buttons using the keyboard
3. Open the menu using the keyboard (Enter or Space)
4. Use Up and Down arrows to navigate through the menu options
5. Note that the last menu option cannot be selected with the keyboard

### Expected Behavior

Up and down arrow keys move through the menu items, as documented in [Menu keyboard interaction](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview#keyboard-interaction).

### Actual Behavior

Up and down arrow keys do not navigate through all the menu options

### Environment

- Angular: 15.1.2
- CDK/Material: 15.1.2
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Menu): Up and down arrow keys do not cycle through all options" (#26662)
